metadata.title: CVE-2017-13099 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
wolfSSL prior to version 3.12.2 provides a weak Bleichenbacher oracle when any TLS cipher suite using RSA key exchange is negotiated. An attacker can recover the private key from a vulnerable wolfSSL application. This vulnerability is referred to as "ROBOT."

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-13099` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwolfssl32 - 3.13.0+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wolfssl package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.13.0+dfsg-1').
